very amazing game yes

If you love Half Life 2, and mods, then I highly recommend the Half Life 2 MMOD. I've only played for it a bit, but the lighting improvements, animations, and how the game looks visually is very impressive! There's guides on how to install the mod via YouTube. Once installed correctly, you'll get three separate games in your Steam Libray. Half Life 2 MMOD, HL2 EP1 MMOD, and HL2 EP2 MMOD. Not only that, but the story is very fun and relatable many times imo. Plus, if you own the Half Life Series, and Garry's Mod, you can play with the Half Life campaign within Garry's Mod and have double the fun!
Amazing
it sure is

one of the greatest games ever made, changed the industry just as much as if not more than half life 1 with its physics system and how it elaborated on the unique storytelling methods of hl1 with real characters and emotional plot beats

Well another Half-Life game off my list as I play through the entire series in order. 
What a game, the graphics still hold up in my opinion and they never really took me out of the game. It was even a little nostalgic because even though this is my first play through I have seen the assets in this game all my life in custom CSGO and TF2 maps. I will say that in my opinion it is a great game with a very interesting story, however I think I prefer Half-Life (original) to this one, but that might change after I play the next two "episodes" of Half-Life 2. Obviously it is better than Half-Life Blue Shift, and I think I liked it on the same level as Half-Life Opposing Force.  The big difference is the direction the story has gone in. 

Without giving away any major spoilers its a very interesting adventure in a dystopian world where the Combine an alien empire has conquered earth. They definitely had to go in a new direction with the series after Half-Life and its multiple expansions all set at Black-Mesa. After its nuked in Opposing Force they could take the series somewhere else and this is the best most creative way I think they could have chosen to do it. 

When it comes to game-play the combat is good but what really makes this game is the physics and the Gravity Gun! This is genius, I wish more games today did interesting things with physics like this game did. After playing this you would think the game industry has stopped evolving because of how cool these mechanics are from an over sixteen year old game.  

Without giving too much more away, I would definitely recommend this game to people, and the story is easy to get into even if you haven't played the original Half-Life.

cool game even tho it's old

This game saved my life.

I am 27.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 fucking minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you

This game saved my life.

I am 29.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you
